page.title: 12Pebworth Farming (3)
page.content: In l985 only 2 men, both born in Pebworth and following their fathers in this profession, are fully employed as market gardeners, compared with 20 men 40 years ago. l5 acres of land rented from Glos. County Council for open market gardening produce salad onions, parsley, calabrese, sprouts, marrows and cauliflowers. Fruit orchards containing apples, plums and pears cover 6 acres. Under glass l l/2 acres is used for cultivating tomatoes, cucumbers and lettuce. The remaining land owned by Glos. C.C. formerly used for market gardening, is now under arable cultivation. An ornamental horticultural business "Court Farm Nurseries" opened in l985, specialising in pelagoniums, etc & a helibore named "Court Farm", employs ll full time workers & seasonal part time help.
